container.heading: Abandonment or Abuse of Responsible Relatives by Recipients of Care

para.text: In this chapter, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
Terms Defined.
"Abandonment" means wrongful and continuous absence by a:
Spouse from the home for a period of 18 months or longer, immediately before the recipient of services' hospitalization; or
Parent coupled with failure to support a child, or children, for a period of 18 months or more during the child's or children's minority.
"Abuse" or "physical abuse" means:
The sustaining of physical injury;
Cruel or inhumane treatment;
A malicious act or treatment; or
Harm, or threatened harm, to the health or welfare of the individual.
"Crime of violence" means:
Abduction;
Arson;
Burglary;
Daytime housebreaking;
Kidnapping;
Manslaughter, except involuntary manslaughter;
Assault in the first degree;
Murder;
Rape;
Robbery;
Robbery with a deadly weapon;
Sexual offense in the first degree;
Sexual offense in the second degree;
Use of a handgun in the commission of a felony or other crime of violence;
An attempt to commit any one of the following offenses:
Assault with intent to murder;
Assault with intent to rape;
Assault with intent to rob;
Assault with intent to commit a sexual offense in the first degree; and
Assault with intent to commit a sexual offense in the second degree.
"Minority" means the period of time when a child is 17 years old or younger.
"Recipient of services":
Means an individual who receives care, maintenance, treatment, or support in a facility or program that is operated or funded wholly or partly by the Department;
Includes, but is not limited to, an individual in a:
Public facility under the Maryland Mental Law, Health-General Article, Title 10, Annotated Code of Maryland;
Facility or Veteran's Administration hospital for comprehensive evaluation under Health-General Article, Title 7, Annotated Code of Maryland;

Residential, public facility, or a facility from which the State obtains residential care under the Maryland Developmental Disabilities Law, Health-General Article, Title 7, Annotated Code of Maryland; and
Facility operated by the Office of Chronic and Rehabilitation Facilities.
"Responsible relative" means the:
Spouse of a recipient of services;
Parents of a recipient of services who is a minor; and
Children of a recipient of services.
"Sexual abuse":
Means an act that involves sexual molestation or exploitation of a person by another person;
Includes, but is not limited to:
Incest, rape, or sexual offenses in any degree,
Sodomy, and
Unnatural or perverted sexual practices.

section.heading: Scope.
section.text: It is the policy of the Maryland Department of Health, in accordance with:

para.text: Health-General Article, §16-203(a)(3), Annotated Code of Maryland, to excuse a legally responsible relative from contributing to the cost of in-patient care of a recipient of services if that legally responsible relative has been abandoned by the recipient of services;

Health-General Article, §16-203(a)(4), Annotated Code of Maryland, to excuse all legally responsible relatives from contributing to the cost of in-patient care of a recipient of services if that recipient of services has committed any of the following actions in relation to any legally responsible relative:
Abuse or physical abuse;
Crime of violence; or
Sexual abuse.

A responsible relative claiming to have been abused, sexually abused, abandoned, or subjected to a crime of violence by the recipient of services shall have the burden of establishing to the satisfaction of the Department by a preponderance of the evidence that the legally responsible relative was abandoned, abused, sexually abused, or subjected to a crime of violence by the recipient of services.
Acceptable evidence for abuse and crimes of violence includes, but is not limited to:
Police reports; or
Medical records, or medical statements prepared by a physician, physician's assistant, or nurse.
Acceptable evidence for abandonment includes, but is not limited to, affidavits from disinterested parties of the facts surrounding the abandonment.
